intro: Baissea goossensii, commonly known as the Goossens' baissea, is a rare and distinctive plant native to the arid regions of Namibia. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its unique, fleshy, and often spiny stems. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, which bloom during the cooler months. Baissea goossensii is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
